metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19074 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A memory leak in the ath9k_wmi_cmd() function in drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath9k/wmi.c in the Linux kernel through 5.3.11 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption), aka CID-728c1e2a05e4. It was discovered that the Atheros HTC based wireless driver in the Linux kernel did not properly deallocate in certain error conditions. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-aws - 4.4.0-1114.127
No subscription required
